original: LUNDQVIST, Sten Magnus Zachau, Civilingenjör, Göteborg, f Uddev 4/7 96 av dir M L o Clara Zachau, gm Elin Arnell. Studex 15, språkstud i Oxford, stud v KSS, Thulins flygsk samt CTH, diploming (mek) v tekn högsk i Zurich. Anst SKF 18, Götaverken 24 —33, fartygsinspektör f ett ant sv rederier, kontr f ett flert in- o utl fartygsbygg, maskin-exp i Gbgs distr f Germ Lloyds klassn.sällsk, lär i termodynamik o oljemotorer v GTI sed. 31, eg konsult ing.fma f fartyg o maskiner sed. 33. Vkst dir-o styr.led AB Marine Service, styr.led Red.AB C Å Blidberg. Magistr.-besiktningsm i Gbg. Resor: Engl 14, vist i Schweiz 19—24, USA 24, Tyskl, Holl, Norge, Danm, Ital, Polen, Frankr o Engl uppr ggr 1 samb m öl uppdr. Medl The Royal Bachelor’s Club, Tekn Saml Hobby: Motorsport (bilism, sportflyg). °LUNDSTEDT, Arvid Nestor, Fabrikör, Vadstena, f Vadstena 26/2 71 av gelbgjutare Aug L o Mathilda Pettersson, gm Jenny Johansson. Inneh tills m ing Ivar Lundstedt fma Lund-stedts Bil AB i Vadstena. Stdsflm, led av drätselk 27—31, tillh beredn.utsk.
translated: LUNDQVIST, Sten Magnus Zachau, Civil Engineer, Gothenburg, born in Uddevalla on April 7, 1896, son of director M L and Clara Zachau, married to Elin Arnell. Studied at Oxford, specializing in languages, studied at KSS, Thulins Aviation School, and CTH, obtained a diploma (mechanics) from the Zurich Technical University. Employed at SKF from 1918, at Götaverken from 1924 to 1933, served as a ship inspector for several shipping companies, managed contracts for both domestic and foreign shipbuilding, worked as a mechanical expert for Germ Lloyd's Classification Society in the Gothenburg district, taught thermodynamics and oil engines at GTI since 1931, and worked as an independent consultant for ships and machinery since 1933. Vice Director and Member of the Board of AB Marine Service, Member of the Board of Red AB C Å Blidberg. Magistrate's Inspector in Gothenburg. Traveled to England in 1914, stayed in Switzerland from 1919 to 1924, visited the USA in 1924, and also traveled to Germany, the Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, Italy, Poland, France, and England on several occasions in connection with assignments. Member of The Royal Bachelor's Club, Technical Society. Hobby: Motorsport (car racing, sport aviation). °LUNDSTEDT, Arvid Nestor, Manufacturer, Vadstena, born in Vadstena on February 26, 1871, son of brass founder Aug L and Mathilda Pettersson, married to Jenny Johansson. Owner together with Ivar Lundstedt of Lundstedts Bil AB in Vadstena. City film inspector, member of the local council from 1927 to 1931, served on the preparatory committee.

education.name: CTH
education.description: Diploma in Mechanics from Zurich Technical University
